DataElement.preferredName: Participant Blood Specimen Refusal Reason Text
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The free text field used to describe the reason the participant did not give consent to participating in optional study components.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information pertaining to the participant's refusal to take part in various research activities.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

Property.preferredDefinition: Blood circulating throughout the body.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.:To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

Concepts.definition: A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Participant Blood Specimen Refuse Reason Text
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A free text field used to describe the reason the participant refused to take part in a blood specimen activity.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the management of a research protocol and its case report forms.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Participant Blood Specimen Refuse Reason Text
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Someone who takes part in an activity.:Blood circulating throughout the body.:Specimen; a bit of tissue or blood or urine that is taken or used for research purposes.:To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.:An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.:Text; the words of something written.

Concepts.definition: Someone who takes part in an activity.

A liquid tissue; its major function is to transport oxygen throughout the body. It also supplies the tissues with nutrients, removes waste products, and contains various components of the immune system defending the body against infection. Several hormones also travel in the blood.

A part of a thing, or of several things, taken to demonstrate or to determine the character of the whole, e.g. a substance, or portion of material obtained for use in testing, examination, or study; particularly, a preparation of tissue or bodily fluid taken for examination or diagnosis.
To decline to do, accept, give, or allow something.
An explanation of the cause of some phenomenon or action.
